page.title: 05VISIT TO MARSHALL'S
page.content: One morning we set off for Marshall's at Brookfoot. We passed the stone works and went to the head office. A man named Maurice came to meet us and take us to another room. Here a man showed us how a drainage system worked. Water flowed into little holes in the path and into a pipe drainage system where the water flows into a pipe and into the sewers. In the room there were examples of Marshall's stone. In the stone works there is a tall building and a muddy river which looks like wet cement. We looked at a quarry and stacks of stone. We then walked round and saw a massive piece of sandstone being cut into bits by a huge saw being run by a big wheel.
